18658.text: /_‘Where on earth did these children come from?/I lost everything, had nothing, was exiled and penniless./_So who reared these children?/_How did these children get here?’”

18659.text: ¶The Master, God, says:¶“Look! I signal to the nations,/_I raise my flag to summon the people./Here they’ll come: women carrying your little boys in their arms,/_men carrying your little girls on their shoulders.

18660.text: /Kings will be your babysitters,/_princesses will be your nursemaids./They’ll offer to do all your drudge work—/_scrub your floors, do your laundry./You’ll know then that I am God./_No one who hopes in me ever regrets it.”

18661.text: ¶Can plunder be retrieved from a giant,/_prisoners of war gotten back from a tyrant?

18662.text: /But God says, “Even if a giant grips the plunder/_and a tyrant holds my people prisoner,/I’m the one who’s on your side,/_defending your cause, rescuing your children.

18663.text: /And your enemies, crazed and desperate, will turn on themselves,/_killing each other in a frenzy of self‐destruction./Then everyone will know that I, God,/_have saved you—I, the Mighty One of Jacob.”

18664.text: §¶God says: ¶▼“Can you produce your mother’s divorce papers/_proving I got rid of her?/Can you produce a receipt/_proving I sold you?/Of course you can’t./_It’s your sins that put you here,/_your wrongs that got you shipped out.

18665.text: /So why didn’t anyone come when I knocked?/_Why didn’t anyone answer when I called?/Do you think I’ve forgotten how to help?/_Am I so decrepit that I can’t deliver?/I’m as powerful as ever,/_and can reverse what I once did:/I can dry up the sea with a word,/_turn river water into desert sand,/And leave the fish stinking in the sun,/_stranded on dry land . . .

18666.text: /Turn all the lights out in the sky/_and pull down the curtain.”

18667.text: ¶The Master, God, has given me/_a well‐taught tongue,/So I know how to encourage tired people./_He wakes me up in the morning,/Wakes me up, opens my ears/_to listen as one ready to take orders.

18668.text: /The Master, God, opened my ears,/_and I didn’t go back to sleep,/_didn’t pull the covers back over my head./I followed orders,

18669.text: /_stood there and took it while they beat me,/_held steady while they pulled out my beard,/Didn’t dodge their insults,/_faced them as they spit in my face.

18670.text: /And the Master, God, stays right there and helps me,/_so I’m not disgraced./Therefore I set my face like flint,/_confident that I’ll never regret this.

18671.text: /My champion is right here./_Let’s take our stand together!/Who dares bring suit against me?/_Let him try!/Look! the Master, God, is right here./_Who would dare call me guilty?

18672.text: /Look! My accusers are a clothes bin of threadbare/_socks and shirts, fodder for moths!

18673.text: ¶Who out there fears God,/_actually listens to the voice of his servant?/For anyone out there who doesn’t know where you’re going,/_anyone groping in the dark,/Here’s what: Trust in God./_Lean on your God!

18674.text: /But if all you’re after is making trouble,/_playing with fire,¶Go ahead and see where it gets you./_Set your fires, stir people up, blow on the flames,/But don’t expect me to just stand there and watch./_I’ll hold your feet to those flames.

18675.text: §¶“Listen to me, all you who are serious about right living/_and committed to seeking God./Ponder the rock from which you were cut,/_the quarry from which you were dug.

18676.text: /Yes, ponder Abraham, your father,/_and Sarah, who bore you./Think of it! One solitary man when I called him,/_but once I blessed him, he multiplied.

18677.text: /Likewise I, God, will comfort Zion,/_comfort all her mounds of ruins./I’ll transform her dead ground into Eden,/_her moonscape into the garden of God,/A place filled with exuberance and laughter,/_thankful voices and melodic songs.

18678.text: ¶“Pay attention, my people./_Listen to me, nations./Revelation flows from me./_My decisions light up the world.

18679.text: /My deliverance arrives on the run,/_my salvation right on time./_I’ll bring justice to the peoples./Even faraway islands will look to me/_and take hope in my saving power.

18680.text: /Look up at the skies,/_ponder the earth under your feet./The skies will fade out like smoke,/_the earth will wear out like work pants,/_and the people will die off like flies./But my salvation will last forever,

18681.text: /¶“Listen now, you who know right from wrong,/_you who hold my teaching inside you:/Pay no attention to insults, and when mocked/_don’t let it get you down.

18682.text: /Those insults and mockeries are moth‐eaten,/_from brains that are termite‐ridden,/But my setting‐things‐right lasts,/_my salvation goes on and on and on.”

18683.text: _my setting‐things‐right will never be obsolete.  ¶Wake up, wake up, flex your muscles, God!/_Wake up as in the old days, in the long ago./Didn’t you once make mincemeat of Rahab,/_dispatch the old chaos‐dragon?

18684.text: /And didn’t you once dry up the sea,/_the powerful waters of the deep,/And then made the bottom of the ocean a road/_for the redeemed to walk across?

18685.text: /In the same way God’s ransomed will come back,/_come back to Zion cheering, shouting,/Joy eternal wreathing their heads,/_exuberant ecstasies transporting them—/_and not a sign of moans or groans.

18686.text: §¶“I, I’m the One comforting you./_What are you afraid of—or who?/Some man or woman who’ll soon be dead?/_Some poor wretch destined for dust?

18687.text: /You’ve forgotten me, God, who made you,/_who unfurled the skies, who founded the earth./And here you are, quaking like an aspen/_before the tantrums of a tyrant/_who thinks he can kick down the world./But what will come of the tantrums?

18688.text: /_The victims will be released before you know it./They’re not going to die./_They’re not even going to go hungry.

18689.text: /For I am God, your very own God,/_who stirs up the sea and whips up the waves,/_named God‐of‐the‐Angel‐Armies.

18690.text: /I teach you how to talk, word by word,/_and personally watch over you,/Even while I’m unfurling the skies,/_setting earth on solid foundations,/_and greeting Zion: ‘Welcome, my people!’”

18691.text: ¶So wake up! Rub the sleep from your eyes!/_Up on your feet, Jerusalem!/You’ve drunk the cup God handed you,/_the strong drink of his anger./You drank it down to the last drop,/_staggered and collapsed, dead‐drunk.

18692.text: /And nobody to help you home,/_no one among your friends or children/_to take you by the hand and put you in bed.

18693.text: /You’ve been hit with a double dose of trouble/_—does anyone care?/Assault and battery, hunger and death/_—will anyone comfort?

18694.text: /Your sons and daughters have passed out,/_strewn in the streets like stunned rabbits,/Sleeping off the strong drink of God’s anger,/_the rage of your God.

18695.text: ¶Therefore listen, please,/_you with your splitting headaches,/You who are nursing the hangovers/_that didn’t come from drinking wine.

18696.text: /Your Master, your God, has something to say,/_your God has taken up his people’s case:/“Look, I’ve taken back the drink that sent you reeling./_No more drinking from that jug of my anger!

18697.text: /I’ve passed it over to your abusers to drink, those who ordered you,/_‘Down on the ground so we can walk all over you!’/And you had to do it. Flat on the ground,/_you were the dirt under their feet.”

18698.text: §¶Wake up, wake up! Pull on your boots, Zion!/_Dress up in your Sunday best, Jerusalem, holy city!/Those who want no part of God have been culled out./_They won’t be coming along.

18699.text: /Brush off the dust and get to your feet, captive Jerusalem! ¶►Throw off your chains, captive daughter of Zion!

18700.text: ¶God says, “You were sold for nothing. You’re being bought back for nothing.”

18701.text: ¶Again, the Master, God, says, “Early on, my people went to Egypt and lived, strangers in the land. At the other end, Assyria oppressed them.

18702.text: And now, what have I here?” God’s Decree. “My people are hauled off again for no reason at all. Tyrants on the warpath, whooping it up, and day after day, incessantly, my reputation blackened.

18703.text: Now it’s time that my people know who I am, what I’m made of—yes, that I have something to say. Here I am!”

18704.text: ¶How beautiful on the mountains/_are the feet of the messenger bringing good news,/Breaking the news that all’s well,/_proclaiming good times, announcing salvation,/_telling Zion, “Your God reigns!”

18705.text: /Voices! Listen! Your scouts are shouting, thunderclap shouts,/_shouting in joyful unison./They see with their own eyes/_God coming back to Zion.

18706.text: /Break into song! Boom it out, ruins of Jerusalem:/_“God has comforted his people!/_He’s redeemed Jerusalem!”

18707.text: /God has rolled up his sleeves./_All the nations can see his holy, muscled arm./Everyone, from one end of the earth to the other,/_sees him at work, doing his salvation work.

18708.text: ¶Out of here! Out of here! Leave this place!/_Don’t look back. Don’t contaminate yourselves with plunder./Just leave, but leave clean. Purify yourselves/_in the process of worship, carrying the holy vessels of God.

18709.text: /But you don’t have to be in a hurry./_You’re not running from anybody!/God is leading you out of here,/_and the God of Israel is also your rear guard.

18710.text: §¶“Just watch my servant blossom!/_Exalted, tall, head and shoulders above the crowd!/But he didn’t begin that way.

18711.text: /_At first everyone was appalled./He didn’t even look human—/_a ruined face, disfigured past recognition.

18712.text: /Nations all over the world will be in awe, taken aback,/_kings shocked into silence when they see him./For what was unheard of they’ll see with their own eyes,/_what was unthinkable they’ll have right before them.”

18713.text: ¶Who believes what we’ve heard and seen?/_Who would have thought God’s saving power would look like this?

18714.text: ¶The servant grew up before God—a scrawny seedling,/_a scrubby plant in a parched field./There was nothing attractive about him,/_nothing to cause us to take a second look.

18715.text: /He was looked down on and passed over,/_a man who suffered, who knew pain firsthand./One look at him and people turned away./_We looked down on him, thought he was scum.

18716.text: /But the fact is, it was our pains he carried—/_our disfigurements, all the things wrong with us./We thought he brought it on himself,/_that God was punishing him for his own failures.

18717.text: /But it was our sins that did that to him,/_that ripped and tore and crushed him—our sins!/He took the punishment, and that made us whole./_Through his bruises we get healed.

18718.text: /We’re all like sheep who’ve wandered off and gotten lost./_We’ve all done our own thing, gone our own way./And God has piled all our sins, everything we’ve done wrong,/_on him, on him.

18719.text: ¶He was beaten, he was tortured,/_but he didn’t say a word./Like a lamb taken to be slaughtered/_and like a sheep being sheared,/_he took it all in silence.

18720.text: /Justice miscarried, and he was led off—/_and did anyone really know what was happening?/He died without a thought for his own welfare,/_beaten bloody for the sins of my people.

18721.text: /They buried him with the wicked,/_threw him in a grave with a rich man,/Even though he’d never hurt a soul/_or said one word that wasn’t true.

18722.text: ¶Still, it’s what God had in mind all along,/_to crush him with pain./The plan was that he give himself as an offering for sin/_so that he’d see life come from it—life, life, and more life./_And God’s plan will deeply prosper through him.

18723.text: ¶Out of that terrible travail of soul,/_he’ll see that it’s worth it and be glad he did it./Through what he experienced, my righteous one, my servant,/_will make many “righteous ones,”/_as he himself carries the burden of their sins.

18724.text: /Therefore I’ll reward him extravagantly—/_the best of everything, the highest honors—/Because he looked death in the face and didn’t flinch,/_because he embraced the company of the lowest./He took on his own shoulders the sin of the many,/_he took up the cause of all the black sheep.

18725.text: §¶“Sing, barren woman, who has never had a baby./_Fill the air with song, you who’ve never experienced childbirth!/You’re ending up with far more children/_than all those childbearing women.” God says so!

18726.text: /“Clear lots of ground for your tents!/_Make your tents large. Spread out! Think big!/Use plenty of rope,/_drive the tent pegs deep.

18727.text: /You’re going to need lots of elbow room/_for your growing family./You’re going to take over whole nations;/_you’re going to resettle abandoned cities.

18728.text: /Don’t be afraid—you’re not going to be embarrassed./_Don’t hold back—you’re not going to come up short./You’ll forget all about the humiliations of your youth,/_and the indignities of being a widow will fade from memory.

18729.text: /For your Maker is your bridegroom,/_his name, God‐of‐the‐Angel‐Armies!/Your Redeemer is The Holy of Israel,/_known as God of the whole earth.

18730.text: /You were like an abandoned wife, devastated with grief,/_and God welcomed you back,/Like a woman married young/_and then left,” says your God.

18731.text: ¶Your Redeemer God says:¶“I left you, but only for a moment./_Now, with enormous compassion, I’m bringing you back.

18732.text: /In an outburst of anger I turned my back on you—/_but only for a moment./It’s with lasting love/_that I’m tenderly caring for you.

18733.text: ¶“This exile is just like the days of Noah for me:/_I promised then that the waters of Noah/_would never again flood the earth./I’m promising now no more anger,/_no more dressing you down.

18734.text: /For even if the mountains walk away/_and the hills fall to pieces,/My love won’t walk away from you,/_my covenant commitment of peace won’t fall apart.”/_The God who has compassion on you says so.

18735.text: ¶“Afflicted city, storm‐battered, unpitied:/_I’m about to rebuild you with stones of turquoise,/Lay your foundations with sapphires,

18736.text: /_construct your towers with rubies,/Your gates with jewels,/_and all your walls with precious stones.

18737.text: /All your children will have God for their teacher—/_what a mentor for your children!

18738.text: /You’ll be built solid, grounded in righteousness,/_far from any trouble—nothing to fear!/_far from terror—it won’t even come close!

18739.text: /If anyone attacks you,/_don’t for a moment suppose that I sent them,/And if any should attack,/_nothing will come of it.

18740.text: /I create the blacksmith/_who fires up his forge/_and makes a weapon designed to kill./I also create the destroyer—

18741.text: /_but no weapon that can hurt you has ever been forged./Any accuser who takes you to court/_will be dismissed as a liar./This is what God’s servants can expect./_I’ll see to it that everything works out for the best.”/_God’s Decree.

18742.text: §¶“Hey there! All who are thirsty,/_come to the water!/Are you penniless?/_Come anyway—buy and eat!/Come, buy your drinks, buy wine and milk./_Buy without money—everything’s free!

18743.text: /Why do you spend your money on junk food,/_your hard‐earned cash on cotton candy?/Listen to me, listen well: Eat only the best,/_fill yourself with only the finest.

18744.text: /Pay attention, come close now,/_listen carefully to my life‐giving, life‐nourishing words./I’m making a lasting covenant commitment with you,/_the same that I made with David: sure, solid, enduring love.

18745.text: /I set him up as a witness to the nations,/_made him a prince and leader of the nations,/And now I’m doing it to you:

18746.text: /_You’ll summon nations you’ve never heard of,/and nations who’ve never heard of you/_will come running to you/Because of me, your God,/_because The Holy of Israel has honored you.”

18747.text: ¶Seek God while he’s here to be found,/_pray to him while he’s close at hand.

18748.text: /Let the wicked abandon their way of life/_and the evil their way of thinking./Let them come back to God, who is merciful,/_come back to our God, who is lavish with forgiveness.

18749.text: ¶“I don’t think the way you think./_The way you work isn’t the way I work.”/_God’s Decree.

18750.text: /“For as the sky soars high above earth,/_so the way I work surpasses the way you work,/_and the way I think is beyond the way you think.

18751.text: /Just as rain and snow descend from the skies/_and don’t go back until they’ve watered the earth,/Doing their work of making things grow and blossom,/_producing seed for farmers and food for the hungry,

18752.text: /So will the words that come out of my mouth/_not come back empty‐handed./They’ll do the work I sent them to do,/_they’ll complete the assignment I gave them.

18753.text: ¶“So you’ll go out in joy,/_you’ll be led into a whole and complete life./The mountains and hills will lead the parade,/_bursting with song./All the trees of the forest will join the procession,/_exuberant with applause.

18754.text: /No more thistles, but giant sequoias,/_no more thornbushes, but stately pines—/Monuments to me, to God,/_living and lasting evidence of God.”

18755.text: Messages of Hope§¶God’s Message: ¶▼“Guard my common good:/_Do what’s right and do it in the right way,/For salvation is just around the corner,/_my setting‐things‐right is about to go into action.

18756.text: /How blessed are you who enter into these things,/_you men and women who embrace them,/Who keep Sabbath and don’t defile it,/_who watch your step and don’t do anything evil!

18757.text: /Make sure no outsider who now follows God/_ever has occasion to say, ‘God put me in second‐class./_I don’t really belong.’/And make sure no physically mutilated person/_is ever made to think, ‘I’m damaged goods./_I don’t really belong.’”

18758.text: ¶For God says:¶“To the mutilated who keep my Sabbaths/_and choose what delights me/_and keep a firm grip on my covenant,

18759.text: /I’ll provide them an honored place/_in my family and within my city,/_even more honored than that of sons and daughters./I’ll confer permanent honors on them/_that will never be revoked.

18760.text: ¶“And as for the outsiders who now follow me,/_working for me, loving my name,/_and wanting to be my servants—/All who keep Sabbath and don’t defile it,/_holding fast to my covenant—

18761.text: /I’ll bring them to my holy mountain/_and give them joy in my house of prayer./They’ll be welcome to worship the same as the ‘insiders,’/_to bring burnt offerings and sacrifices to my altar./Oh yes, my house of worship/_will be known as a house of prayer for all people.”

18762.text: /The Decree of the Master, God himself,/_who gathers in the exiles of Israel:/“I will gather others also,/_gather them in with those already gathered.”

18763.text: ¶A call to the savage beasts: Come on the run./_Come, devour, beast barbarians!

18764.text: /For Israel’s watchmen are blind, the whole lot of them./_They have no idea what’s going on./They’re dogs without sense enough to bark,/_lazy dogs, dreaming in the sun—

18765.text: /But hungry dogs, they do know how to eat,/_voracious dogs, with never enough./And these are Israel’s shepherds!/_They know nothing, understand nothing./They all look after themselves,/_grabbing whatever’s not nailed down.

18766.text: /“Come,” they say, “let’s have a party./_Let’s go out and get drunk!”/And tomorrow, more of the same:/_“Let’s live it up!”

18767.text: §¶Meanwhile, right‐living people die/_and no one gives them a thought./God‐fearing people are carted off/_and no one even notices./The right‐living people are out of their misery,

18768.text: /_they’re finally at rest./They lived well and with dignity/_and now they’re finally at peace.

18769.text: ¶“But you, children of a witch, come here!/_Sons of a slut, daughters of a whore.

18770.text: /What business do you have taunting,/_sneering, and sticking out your tongue?/Do you have any idea what wretches you’ve turned out to be?/_A race of rebels, a generation of liars.

18771.text: /You satisfy your lust any place you find some shade/_and fornicate at whim./You kill your children at any convenient spot—/_any cave or crevasse will do.

18772.text: /You take stones from the creek/_and set up your sex‐and‐religion shrines./You’ve chosen your fate./_Your worship will be your doom.

18773.text: /You’ve climbed a high mountain/_to practice your foul sex‐and‐death religion.

18774.text: /Behind closed doors/_you assemble your precious gods and goddesses./Deserting me, you’ve gone all out, stripped down/_and made your bed your place of worship./You’ve climbed into bed with the ‘sacred’ whores/_and loved every minute of it,/_adoring every curve of their naked bodies.

18775.text: /You anoint your king‐god with ointments/_and lavish perfumes on yourselves./You send scouts to search out the latest in religion,/_send them all the way to hell and back.

18776.text: /You wear yourselves out trying the new and the different,/_and never see what a waste it all is./You’ve always found strength for the latest fad,/_never got tired of trying new religions.

18777.text: ¶“Who talked you into the pursuit of this nonsense,/_leaving me high and dry,/_forgetting you ever knew me?/Because I don’t yell and make a scene/_do you think I don’t exist?

18778.text: /I’ll go over, detail by detail, all your ‘righteous’ attempts at religion,/_and expose the absurdity of it all.

18779.text: /Go ahead, cry for help to your collection of no‐gods:/_A good wind will blow them away./_They’re smoke, nothing but smoke.¶“But anyone who runs to me for help/_will inherit the land,/_will end up owning my holy mountain!”

18780.text: ¶Someone says: “Build, build! Make a road!/_Clear the way, remove the rocks/_from the road my people will travel.”

18781.text: ¶A Message from the high and towering God,/_who lives in Eternity,/_whose name is Holy:/“I live in the high and holy places,/_but also with the low‐spirited, the spirit‐crushed,/And what I do is put new spirit in them,/_get them up and on their feet again.

18782.text: /For I’m not going to haul people into court endlessly,/_I’m not going to be angry forever./Otherwise, people would lose heart./_These souls I created would tire out and give up.

18783.text: /I was angry, good and angry, because of Israel’s sins./_I struck him hard and turned away in anger,/_while he kept at his stubborn, willful ways.

18784.text: /When I looked again and saw what he was doing,/_I decided to heal him, lead him, and comfort him,/_creating a new language of praise for the mourners.

18785.text: /Peace to the far‐off, peace to the near‐at‐hand,” says God—/_“and yes, I will heal them.

18786.text: /But the wicked are storm‐battered seas/_that can’t quiet down./_The waves stir up garbage and mud.

18787.text: /There’s no peace,” God says, “for the wicked.”

18788.text: §¶“Shout! A full‐throated shout!/_Hold nothing back—a trumpet‐blast shout!/Tell my people what’s wrong with their lives,/_face my family Jacob with their sins!

18789.text: /They’re busy, busy, busy at worship,/_and love studying all about me./To all appearances they’re a nation of right‐living people—/_law‐abiding, God‐honoring./They ask me, ‘What’s the right thing to do?’/_and love having me on their side.

18790.text: /But they also complain,/_‘Why do we fast and you don’t look our way?/_Why do we humble ourselves and you don’t even notice?’ ¶“Well, here’s why:¶“The bottom line on your ‘fast days’ is profit./_You drive your employees much too hard.

18791.text: /You fast, but at the same time you bicker and fight./_You fast, but you swing a mean fist./The kind of fasting you do/_won’t get your prayers off the ground.

18792.text: /Do you think this is the kind of fast day I’m after:/_a day to show off humility?/To put on a pious long face/_and parade around solemnly in black?/Do you call that fasting,/_a fast day that I, God, would like?

18793.text: ¶“This is the kind of fast day I’m after:/_to break the chains of injustice,/_get rid of exploitation in the workplace,/_free the oppressed,/_cancel debts./What I’m interested in seeing you do is:

18794.text: /_sharing your food with the hungry,/_inviting the homeless poor into your homes,/_putting clothes on the shivering ill‐clad,/_being available to your own families.

18795.text: /Do this and the lights will turn on,/_and your lives will turn around at once./Your righteousness will pave your way./_The God of glory will secure your passage.

18796.text: /Then when you pray, God will answer./_You’ll call out for help and I’ll say, ‘Here I am.’ §¶“If you get rid of unfair practices,/_quit blaming victims,/_quit gossiping about other people’s sins,

18797.text: /If you are generous with the hungry/_and start giving yourselves to the down‐and‐out,/Your lives will begin to glow in the darkness,/_your shadowed lives will be bathed in sunlight.

18798.text: /I will always show you where to go./_I’ll give you a full life in the emptiest of places—/_firm muscles, strong bones./You’ll be like a well‐watered garden,/_a gurgling spring that never runs dry.

18799.text: /You’ll use the old rubble of past lives to build anew,/_rebuild the foundations from out of your past./You’ll be known as those who can fix anything,/_restore old ruins, rebuild and renovate,/_make the community livable again.

18800.text: ¶“If you watch your step on the Sabbath/_and don’t use my holy day for personal advantage,/If you treat the Sabbath as a day of joy,/_God’s holy day as a celebration,/If you honor it by refusing ‘business as usual,’/_making money, running here and there—

18801.text: /Then you’ll be free to enjoy God!/_Oh, I’ll make you ride high and soar above it all./I’ll make you feast on the inheritance of your ancestor Jacob.”/_Yes! God says so!

18802.text: §¶Look! Listen!/_God’s arm is not amputated—he can still save./_God’s ears are not stopped up—he can still hear.

18803.text: /There’s nothing wrong with God; the wrong is in you./_Your wrongheaded lives caused the split between you and God./_Your sins got between you so that he doesn’t hear.

18804.text: /Your hands are drenched in blood,/_your fingers dripping with guilt,/Your lips smeared with lies,/_your tongue swollen from muttering obscenities.

18805.text: /No one speaks up for the right,/_no one deals fairly./They trust in illusion, they tell lies,/_they get pregnant with mischief and have sin‐babies.

18806.text: /They hatch snake eggs and weave spider webs./_Eat an egg and die; break an egg and get a snake!

18807.text: /The spider webs are no good for shirts or shawls./_No one can wear these weavings!/They weave wickedness,/_they hatch violence.

18808.text: /They compete in the race to do evil/_and run to be the first to murder./They plan and plot evil, think and breathe evil,/_and leave a trail of wrecked lives behind them.

18809.text: /They know nothing about peace/_and less than nothing about justice./They make tortuously twisted roads./_No peace for the wretch who walks down those roads!

18810.text: ¶Which means that we’re a far cry from fair dealing,/_and we’re not even close to right living./We long for light but sink into darkness,/_long for brightness but stumble through the night.

18811.text: /Like the blind, we inch along a wall,/_groping eyeless in the dark./We shuffle our way in broad daylight,/_like the dead, but somehow walking.

18812.text: /We’re no better off than bears, groaning,/_and no worse off than doves, moaning./We look for justice—not a sign of it;/_for salvation—not so much as a hint.

18813.text: ¶Our wrongdoings pile up before you, God,/_our sins stand up and accuse us./Our wrongdoings stare us down;/_we know in detail what we’ve done:

18814.text: /Mocking and denying God,/_not following our God,/Spreading false rumors, inciting sedition,/_pregnant with lies, muttering malice.

18815.text: /Justice is beaten back,/_Righteousness is banished to the sidelines,/Truth staggers down the street,/_Honesty is nowhere to be found,

18816.text: /Good is missing in action./_Anyone renouncing evil is beaten and robbed. ¶God looked and saw evil looming on the horizon—/_so much evil and no sign of Justice.

18817.text: /He couldn’t believe what he saw:/_not a soul around to correct this awful situation./So he did it himself, took on the work of Salvation,/_fueled by his own Righteousness.

18818.text: /He dressed in Righteousness, put it on like a suit of armor,/_with Salvation on his head like a helmet,/Put on Judgment like an overcoat,/_and threw a cloak of Passion across his shoulders.

18819.text: /He’ll make everyone pay for what they’ve done:/_fury for his foes, just deserts for his enemies./_Even the far‐off islands will get paid off in full.

18820.text: /In the west they’ll fear the name of God,/_in the east they’ll fear the glory of God,/For he’ll arrive like a river in flood stage,/_whipped to a torrent by the wind of God.

18821.text: ¶“I’ll arrive in Zion as Redeemer,/_to those in Jacob who leave their sins.”/_God’s Decree.

18822.text: ¶“As for me,” God says, “this is my covenant with them: My Spirit that I’ve placed upon you and the words that I’ve given you to speak, they’re not going to leave your mouths nor the mouths of your children nor the mouths of your grandchildren. You will keep repeating these words and won’t ever stop.” God’s orders.

18823.text: §¶“Get out of bed, Jerusalem!/_Wake up. Put your face in the sunlight./_God’s bright glory has risen for you.

18824.text: /The whole earth is wrapped in darkness,/_all people sunk in deep darkness,/But God rises on you,/_his sunrise glory breaks over you.

18825.text: /Nations will come to your light,/_kings to your sunburst brightness.

18826.text: /Look up! Look around!/_Watch as they gather, watch as they approach you:/Your sons coming from great distances,/_your daughters carried by their nannies.

18827.text: /When you see them coming you’ll smile—big smiles!/_Your heart will swell and, yes, burst!/All those people returning by sea for the reunion,/_a rich harvest of exiles gathered in from the nations!

18828.text: /And then streams of camel caravans as far as the eye can see,/_young camels of nomads in Midian and Ephah,/Pouring in from the south from Sheba,/_loaded with gold and frankincense,/_preaching the praises of God.

18829.text: /And yes, a great roundup/_of flocks from the nomads in Kedar and Nebaioth,/Welcome gifts for worship at my altar/_as I bathe my glorious Temple in splendor.

18830.text: §¶“What’s that we see in the distance,/_a cloud on the horizon, like doves darkening the sky?

18831.text: /It’s ships from the distant islands,/_the famous Tarshish ships/Returning your children from faraway places,/_loaded with riches, with silver and gold,/And backed by the name of your God, The Holy of Israel,/_showering you with splendor.

18832.text: /Foreigners will rebuild your walls,/_and their kings assist you in the conduct of worship./When I was angry I hit you hard./_It’s my desire now to be tender.

18833.text: /Your Jerusalem gates will always be open/_—open house day and night!—/Receiving deliveries of wealth from all nations,/_and their kings, the delivery boys!

18834.text: /Any nation or kingdom that doesn’t deliver will perish;/_those nations will be totally wasted.

18835.text: /The rich woods of Lebanon will be delivered/_—all that cypress and oak and pine—/To give a splendid elegance to my Sanctuary,/_as I make my footstool glorious.

18836.text: /The descendants of your oppressor/_will come bowing and scraping to you./All who looked down at you in contempt/_will lick your boots./They’ll confer a title on you: City of God,/_Zion of The Holy of Israel.

18837.text: /Not long ago you were despised refuse—/_out‐of‐the‐way, unvisited, ignored./But now I’ve put you on your feet,/_towering and grand forever, a joy to look at!

18838.text: /When you suck the milk of nations/_and the breasts of royalty,/You’ll know that I, God, am your Savior,/_your Redeemer, Champion of Jacob.

18839.text: /I’ll give you only the best—no more hand‐me‐downs!/_Gold instead of bronze, silver instead of iron,/_bronze instead of wood, iron instead of stones./I’ll install Peace to run your country,/_make Righteousness your boss.

18840.text: /There’ll be no more stories of crime in your land,/_no more robberies, no more vandalism./You’ll name your main street Salvation Way,/_and install Praise Park at the center of town.

18841.text: /You’ll have no more need of the sun by day/_nor the brightness of the moon at night./God will be your eternal light,/_your God will bathe you in splendor.

18842.text: /Your sun will never go down,/_your moon will never fade./I will be your eternal light./_Your days of grieving are over.

18843.text: /All your people will live right and well,/_in permanent possession of the land./They’re the green shoot that I planted,/_planted with my own hands to display my glory.

18844.text: /The runt will become a great tribe,/_the weakling become a strong nation./I am God./_At the right time I’ll make it happen.”

18845.text: §¶The Spirit of God, the Master, is on me/_because God anointed me./He sent me to preach good news to the poor,/_heal the heartbroken,/Announce freedom to all captives,/_pardon all prisoners.

18846.text: /God sent me to announce the year of his grace—/_a celebration of God’s destruction of our enemies—/_and to comfort all who mourn,

18847.text: /To care for the needs of all who mourn in Zion,/_give them bouquets of roses instead of ashes,/Messages of joy instead of news of doom,/_a praising heart instead of a languid spirit./Rename them “Oaks of Righteousness”/_planted by God to display his glory.

18848.text: /They’ll rebuild the old ruins,/_raise a new city out of the wreckage./They’ll start over on the ruined cities,/_take the rubble left behind and make it new.

18849.text: /You’ll hire outsiders to herd your flocks/_and foreigners to work your fields,

18850.text: /But you’ll have the title “Priests of God,”/_honored as ministers of our God./You’ll feast on the bounty of nations,/_you’ll bask in their glory.

18851.text: /Because you got a double dose of trouble/_and more than your share of contempt,/Your inheritance in the land will be doubled/_and your joy go on forever.

18852.text: ¶“Because I, God, love fair dealing/_and hate thievery and crime,/I’ll pay your wages on time and in full,/_and establish my eternal covenant with you.

18853.text: /Your descendants will become well‐known all over./_Your children in foreign countries/Will be recognized at once/_as the people I have blessed.”

18854.text: ¶I will sing for joy in God,/_explode in praise from deep in my soul!/He dressed me up in a suit of salvation,/_he outfitted me in a robe of righteousness,/As a bridegroom who puts on a tuxedo/_and a bride a jeweled tiara.

18855.text: /For as the earth bursts with spring wildflowers,/_and as a garden cascades with blossoms,/So the Master, God, brings righteousness into full bloom/_and puts praise on display before the nations.

18856.text: §¶Regarding Zion, I can’t keep my mouth shut,/_regarding Jerusalem, I can’t hold my tongue,/Until her righteousness blazes down like the sun/_and her salvation flames up like a torch.

18857.text: /Foreign countries will see your righteousness,/_and world leaders your glory./You’ll get a brand‐new name/_straight from the mouth of God.

18858.text: /You’ll be a stunning crown in the palm of God’s hand,/_a jeweled gold cup held high in the hand of your God.

18859.text: /No more will anyone call you Rejected,/_and your country will no more be called Ruined./You’ll be called Hephzibah (My Delight),/_and your land Beulah (Married),/Because God delights in you/_and your land will be like a wedding celebration.

18860.text: /For as a young man marries his virgin bride,/_so your builder marries you,/And as a bridegroom is happy in his bride,/_so your God is happy with you.

18861.text: ¶I’ve posted watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem./_Day and night they keep at it, praying, calling out,/_reminding God to remember.

18862.text: /They are to give him no peace until he does what he said,/_until he makes Jerusalem famous as the City of Praise.

18863.text: ¶God has taken a solemn oath,/_an oath he means to keep:/“Never again will I open your grain‐filled barns/_to your enemies to loot and eat./Never again will foreigners drink the wine/_that you worked so hard to produce.

18864.text: /No. The farmers who grow the food will eat the food/_and praise God for it./And those who make the wine will drink the wine/_in my holy courtyards.”

18865.text: ¶Walk out of the gates. Get going!/_Get the road ready for the people./Build the highway. Get at it!/_Clear the debris,/_hoist high a flag, a signal to all peoples!

18866.text: /Yes! God has broadcast to all the world:/_“Tell daughter Zion, ‘Look! Your Savior comes,/Ready to do what he said he’d do,/_prepared to complete what he promised.’”

18867.text: /Zion will be called new names: Holy People, God‐Redeemed,/_Sought‐Out, City‐Not‐Forsaken.

18868.text: §¶The watchmen call out,/“Who goes there, marching out of Edom,/_out of Bozrah in clothes dyed red?/Name yourself, so splendidly dressed,/_advancing, bristling with power!”¶“It is I: I speak what is right,/_I, mighty to save!”

18869.text: ¶“And why are your robes so red,/_your clothes dyed red like those who tread grapes?”

18870.text: ¶“I’ve been treading the winepress alone./_No one was there to help me./Angrily, I stomped the grapes;/_raging, I trampled the people./Their blood spurted all over me—/_all my clothes were soaked with blood.

18871.text: /I was set on vengeance./_The time for redemption had arrived.

18872.text: /I looked around for someone to help/_—no one./I couldn’t believe it/_—not one volunteer./So I went ahead and did it myself,/_fed and fueled by my rage.

18873.text: /I trampled the people in my anger,/_crushed them under foot in my wrath,/_soaked the earth with their lifeblood.”

18874.text: §¶I’ll make a list of God’s gracious dealings,/_all the things God has done that need praising,/All the generous bounties of God,/_his great goodness to the family of Israel—/Compassion lavished,/_love extravagant.

18875.text: /He said, “Without question these are my people,/_children who would never betray me.”/So he became their Savior.

18876.text: /_In all their troubles,/_he was troubled, too./He didn’t send someone else to help them./_He did it himself, in person./Out of his own love and pity/_he redeemed them./He rescued them and carried them along/_for a long, long time.

18877.text: ¶But they turned on him;/_they grieved his Holy Spirit./So he turned on them,/_became their enemy and fought them.

18878.text: ¶Then they remembered the old days,/_the days of Moses, God’s servant:/“Where is he who brought the shepherds of his flock/_up and out of the sea?/And what happened to the One who set/_his Holy Spirit within them?

18879.text: /Who linked his arm with Moses’ right arm,/_divided the waters before them,/Making him famous ever after,

18880.text: /_and led them through the muddy abyss/_as surefooted as horses on hard, level ground?

18881.text: /Like a herd of cattle led to pasture,/_the Spirit of God gave them rest.” ¶That’s how you led your people!/_That’s how you became so famous!

18882.text: /Look down from heaven, look at us!/_Look out the window of your holy and magnificent house!/Whatever happened to your passion,/_your famous mighty acts,/Your heartfelt pity, your compassion?/_Why are you holding back?

18883.text: /You are our Father./_Abraham and Israel are long dead./_They wouldn’t know us from Adam./But you’re our living Father,/_our Redeemer, famous from eternity!

18884.text: /Why, God, did you make us wander from your ways?/_Why did you make us cold and stubborn/_so that we no longer worshiped you in awe?/Turn back for the sake of your servants./_You own us! We belong to you!

18885.text: /For a while your holy people had it good,/_but now our enemies have wrecked your holy place.

18886.text: /For a long time now, you’ve paid no attention to us./_It’s like you never knew us.

18887.text: §¶Oh, that you would rip open the heavens and descend,/_make the mountains shudder at your presence—

18888.text: /As when a forest catches fire,/_as when fire makes a pot to boil—/To shock your enemies into facing you,/_make the nations shake in their boots!

18889.text: /You did terrible things we never expected,/_descended and made the mountains shudder at your presence.

18890.text: /Since before time began/_no one has ever imagined,/No ear heard, no eye seen, a God like you/_who works for those who wait for him.

18891.text: /You meet those who happily do what is right,/_who keep a good memory of the way you work./But how angry you’ve been with us!/_We’ve sinned and kept at it so long!/_Is there any hope for us? Can we be saved?

18892.text: /We’re all sin‐infected, sin‐contaminated./_Our best efforts are grease‐stained rags./We dry up like autumn leaves—/_sin‐dried, we’re blown off by the wind.

18893.text: /No one prays to you/_or makes the effort to reach out to you/Because you’ve turned away from us,/_left us to stew in our sins.

18894.text: ¶Still, God, you are our Father./_We’re the clay and you’re our potter:/_All of us are what you made us.

18895.text: /Don’t be too angry with us, O God./_Don’t keep a permanent account of wrongdoing./_Keep in mind, please, we are your people—all of us.

18896.text: /Your holy cities are all ghost towns:/_Zion’s a ghost town,/_Jerusalem’s a field of weeds.

18897.text: /Our holy and beautiful Temple,/_which our ancestors filled with your praises,/Was burned down by fire,/_all our lovely parks and gardens in ruins.

18898.text: /In the face of all this,/_are you going to sit there unmoved, God?/Aren’t you going to say something?/_Haven’t you made us miserable long enough?

18899.text: §¶“I’ve made myself available/_to those who haven’t bothered to ask./I’m here, ready to be found/_by those who haven’t bothered to look./I kept saying ‘I’m here, I’m right here’/_to a nation that ignored me.

18900.text: /I reached out day after day/_to a people who turned their backs on me,/People who make wrong turns,/_who insist on doing things their own way.

18901.text: /They get on my nerves,/_are rude to my face day after day,/Make up their own kitchen religion,/_a potluck religious stew.

18902.text: /They spend the night in tombs/_to get messages from the dead,/Eat forbidden foods/_and drink a witch’s brew of potions and charms.

18903.text: /They say, ‘Keep your distance./_Don’t touch me. I’m holier than thou.’/These people gag me./_I can’t stand their stench.

18904.text: /Look at this! Their sins are all written out—/_I have the list before me./I’m not putting up with this any longer./_I’ll pay them the wages

18905.text: /They have coming for their sins./_And for the sins of their parents lumped in,/_a bonus.” God says so./“Because they’ve practiced their blasphemous worship,/_mocking me at their hillside shrines,/I’ll let loose the consequences/_and pay them in full for their actions.”

18906.text: ¶God’s Message: ¶▼“But just as one bad apple doesn’t ruin the whole bushel,/_there are still plenty of good apples left./So I’ll preserve those in Israel who obey me./_I won’t destroy the whole nation.

18907.text: /I’ll bring out my true children from Jacob/_and the heirs of my mountains from Judah./My chosen will inherit the land,/_my servants will move in.

18908.text: /The lush valley of Sharon in the west/_will be a pasture for flocks,/And in the east, the valley of Achor,/_a place for herds to graze./These will be for the people/_who bothered to reach out to me, who wanted me in their lives,/_who actually bothered to look for me.

18909.text: ¶“But you who abandon me, your God,/_who forget the holy mountains,/Who hold dinners for Lady Luck/_and throw cocktail parties for Sir Fate,

18910.text: /Well, you asked for it. Fate it will be:/_your destiny, Death./For when I invited you, you ignored me;/_when I spoke to you, you brushed me off./You did the very things I exposed as evil;/_you chose what I hate.”

18911.text: ¶Therefore, this is the Message from the Master, God:¶“My servants will eat,/_and you’ll go hungry;/My servants will drink,/_and you’ll go thirsty;/My servants will rejoice,/_and you’ll hang your heads.

18912.text: /My servants will laugh from full hearts,/_and you’ll cry out heartbroken,/_yes, wail from crushed spirits.

18913.text: /Your legacy to my chosen/_will be your name reduced to a cussword./I, God, will put you to death/_and give a new name to my servants.

18914.text: /Then whoever prays a blessing in the land/_will use my faithful name for the blessing,/And whoever takes an oath in the land/_will use my faithful name for the oath,/Because the earlier troubles are gone and forgotten,/_banished far from my sight.

18915.text: §¶“Pay close attention now:/_I’m creating new heavens and a new earth./All the earlier troubles, chaos, and pain/_are things of the past, to be forgotten.

18916.text: /Look ahead with joy./_Anticipate what I’m creating:/I’ll create Jerusalem as sheer joy,/_create my people as pure delight.

18917.text: /I’ll take joy in Jerusalem,/_take delight in my people:/No more sounds of weeping in the city,/_no cries of anguish;

18918.text: /No more babies dying in the cradle,/_or old people who don’t enjoy a full lifetime;/One‐hundredth birthdays will be considered normal—/_anything less will seem like a cheat.

18919.text: /They’ll build houses/_and move in./They’ll plant fields/_and eat what they grow.

18920.text: /No more building a house/_that some outsider takes over,/No more planting fields/_that some enemy confiscates,/For my people will be as long‐lived as trees,/_my chosen ones will have satisfaction in their work.

18921.text: /They won’t work and have nothing come of it,/_they won’t have children snatched out from under them./For they themselves are plantings blessed by God,/_with their children and grandchildren likewise God‐blessed.

18922.text: /Before they call out, I’ll answer./_Before they’ve finished speaking, I’ll have heard.

18923.text: /Wolf and lamb will graze the same meadow,/_lion and ox eat straw from the same trough,/_but snakes—they’ll get a diet of dirt!/Neither animal nor human will hurt or kill/_anywhere on my Holy Mountain,” says God.

18924.text: §¶God’s Message: ¶▼“Heaven’s my throne,/_earth is my footstool./What sort of house could you build for me?/_What holiday spot reserve for me?

18925.text: /I made all this! I own all this!”/_God’s Decree./“But there is something I’m looking for:/_a person simple and plain,/_reverently responsive to what I say.

18926.text: ¶“Your acts of worship/_are acts of sin:/Your sacrificial slaughter of the ox/_is no different from murdering the neighbor;/Your offerings for worship,/_no different from dumping pig’s blood on the altar;/Your presentation of memorial gifts,/_no different from honoring a no‐god idol./You choose self‐serving worship,/_you delight in self‐centered worship—disgusting!

18927.text: /Well, I choose to expose your nonsense/_and let you realize your worst fears,/Because when I invited you, you ignored me;/_when I spoke to you, you brushed me off./You did the very things I exposed as evil,/_you chose what I hate.”

18928.text: ¶But listen to what God has to say/_to you who reverently respond to his Word:/“Your own families hate you/_and turn you out because of me./They taunt you, ‘Let us see God’s glory!/_If God’s so great, why aren’t you happy?’/But they’re the ones/_who are going to end up shamed.”

18929.text: ¶Rumbles of thunder from the city!/_A voice out of the Temple!/God’s voice,/_handing out judgment to his enemies:

18930.text: ¶“Before she went into labor,/_she had the baby./Before the birth pangs hit,/_she delivered a son.

18931.text: /Has anyone ever heard of such a thing?/_Has anyone seen anything like this?/A country born in a day?/_A nation born in a flash?/But Zion was barely in labor/_when she had her babies!

18932.text: /Do I open the womb/_and not deliver the baby?/Do I, the One who delivers babies,/_shut the womb?

18933.text: ¶“Rejoice, Jerusalem,/_and all who love her, celebrate!/And all you who have shed tears over her,/_join in the happy singing.

18934.text: /You newborns can satisfy yourselves/_at her nurturing breasts./Yes, delight yourselves and drink your fill/_at her ample bosom.”

18935.text: ¶God’s Message:¶“I’ll pour robust well‐being into her like a river,/_the glory of nations like a river in flood./You’ll nurse at her breasts,/_nestle in her bosom,/_and be bounced on her knees.

18936.text: /As a mother comforts her child,/_so I’ll comfort you./_You will be comforted in Jerusalem.”

18937.text: ¶You’ll see all this and burst with joy/_—you’ll feel ten feet tall—/As it becomes apparent that God is on your side/_and against his enemies.

18938.text: /For God arrives like wildfire/_and his chariots like a tornado,/A furious outburst of anger,/_a rebuke fierce and fiery.

18939.text: /For it’s by fire that God brings judgment,/_a death sentence on the human race./Many, oh so many,/_are under God’s sentence of death:

18940.text: ¶“All who enter the sacred groves for initiation in those unholy rituals that climaxed in that foul and obscene meal of pigs and mice will eat together and then die together.” God’s Decree.

18941.text: ¶“I know everything they’ve ever done or thought. I’m going to come and then gather everyone—all nations, all languages. They’ll come and see my glory.

18942.text: I’ll set up a station at the center. I’ll send the survivors of judgment all over the world: Spain and Africa, Turkey and Greece, and the far‐off islands that have never heard of me, who know nothing of what I’ve done nor who I am. I’ll send them out as missionaries to preach my glory among the nations.

18943.text: They’ll return with all your long‐lost brothers and sisters from all over the world. They’ll bring them back and offer them in living worship to God. They’ll bring them on horses and wagons and carts, on mules and camels, straight to my holy mountain Jerusalem,” says God. “They’ll present them just as Israelites present their offerings in a ceremonial vessel in the Temple of God.

18944.text: I’ll even take some of them and make them priests and Levites,” says God.

18945.text: ¶“For just as the new heavens and new earth/_that I am making will stand firm before me”/_—God’s Decree—/“So will your children/_and your reputation stand firm.

18946.text: /Month after month and week by week,/_everyone will come to worship me,” God says.

18947.text: ¶“And then they’ll go out and look at what happened/_to those who rebelled against me. Corpses!/Maggots endlessly eating away on them,/_an endless supply of fuel for fires./Everyone who sees what’s happened/_and smells the stench retches.”
